content.title: High-Output Heart Failure
content.description: Cardiac failure due to high-flow AV fistula

key_concepts.details: Chronic high cardiac output leads to ventricular dilation and eventual failure
Access flow >2 L/min, Qa/CO ratio >0.3, upper arm fistulas
Branham sign (heart rate decrease with fistula compression), echocardiogram
Flow reduction (banding, plication) or access ligation; heart failure management

content.clinical_significance: Underdiagnosed cause of heart failure in dialysis patients

primary_sources: Basile C et al. Nephrol Dial Transplant 2008
